meanings.definition: Wideouts: Wide receivers in American football.
meanings.sent1: The wideouts caught the football and ran towards the end zone.
meanings.sent2: The quarterback threw the ball to the wideouts for a touchdown.
meanings.sent3: During practice, the wideouts decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The wideouts on the team were like cheetahs, swiftly moving across the field.
meanings.sent5: The wideouts' speed and agility made them key players in the game.

meanings.definition: Wideouts: The act of spreading out or extending to a greater width.
meanings.sent1: The wideouts of the river caused flooding in the nearby fields.
meanings.sent2: The wideouts of the branches provided ample shade on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The wideouts of the blanket made it perfect for a picnic with friends.
meanings.sent4: The wideouts of the city lights created a beautiful view from the hilltop.
meanings.sent5: The wideouts of the road led to a scenic drive through the countryside.
